author: Lia McGarrigle
title: What to Buy From American Apparel’s Final Ever Sale
text:
It’s official, American Apparel will be offline by the end of this week.
The brand was bought by Gildan earlier this year after numerous scandals , and its new owner has decided to shut down all of its physical and online stores. Bad news for hardcore American Apparel fans, but good news for those of us looking to cop a bargain or two.
This week marks the last chance for people based in the US to get their hands on some very reduced items, so we rounded up some of our favorites from the still-available stock. Each item is reduced by 50 percent when using the code, “TAKE50”, at the checkout — but, don’t forget, the shop will close late Sunday night.
See our picks below and shop everything over at American Apparel’s site .
The fisherman’s pullover is one of the original American Apparel classics, and this “dark sage” colorway is particularly striking.
Buy Now / $39.00 These 100% cotton jersey shorts come in a relaxed fit and not-too-short length, perfect for exercising or just hanging out.
Buy Now / $19.50 The hoody is what catapulted American Apparel to it’s iconic status so it’s a must-cop in the final sale.
Buy Now / $14.00 Made in the same material as the hoodies, get cosy in these slim fit joggers.
Buy Now / $22.50 This piece is a little different to American Apparel’s usual basics (mainly because it doesn’t have a naval grazing v-neck) but its mock neck and ice blue color are a welcome update to the brands usual style.
Buy Now/ $14.50 The track jacket is a staple, but the purple hue and mock neck on this one makes it stand out.
Buy Now / $34.50 Buy Now / $24.50 With its oversized fit and dropped shoulders, this short sleeve pullover is the perfect casual item to help you transition into summer.
After shopping, read a conflicted love letter to American Apparel.
